item.title: Waitlists and Gap Years
item.dc:creator: dagim
item.description: Selam selam everyone! Since rolling decisions’ results are “rolling” in, this week’s post will be about waitlists and gap years! If you’ve applied to a bunch of colleges before, chances are you’ve been waitlisted to a couple of them. Being waitlisted for a college means you’ve been put on a list of applicants whom a […]

item.title: Got Your Acceptance Letters? Here’s What’s Next
item.dc:creator: richelle
item.description: So, you’ve gotten your acceptance letters, and maybe by this point, you’ve already decided which school you’re going to commit to. (If you haven’t that’s perfectly fine too; take a look at last week’s tip for some advice.) Now what? If you’re going to college for the Fall 2019 semester, you still have a few […]

item.title: Deciding Between Colleges: Which One Should I Go To?
item.dc:creator: benyam
item.description: Trying to decide between two (or more) colleges is a good problem to have. It means you have options, and you probably have a couple of good ones. If you’re excited by more than one of the possibilities within your reach, if you have to decide between two colleges, making your final decision can be […]

item.title: How to Deal With Rejections
item.dc:creator: veronica
item.description: Hey guys, this week’s tip is on dealing with rejection and failure. It’s a bit long so please bear with us. We’ve all failed at something at least once in our lives. And if you haven’t yet … you will. I personally have feared failure since I can remember, all the way back to kindergarten. […]
